methods.void add(int row, int col, double value): Adds 'value' to the specified element in the matrix. aij = aij + value
methods.DenseMatrix64F copy(): Creates and returns a matrix which is idential to this one.
methods.double get(int row, int col): Returns the value of the specified matrix element.
methods.int getIndex(int row, int col): Returns the internal array index for the specified row and column.
methods.int getNumElements(): Returns the number of elements in this matrix, which is equal to the number of rows times the number of columns.
methods.boolean isInBounds(int row, int col): Determins if the specified element is inside the bounds of the Matrix.
methods.void print(): Prints the value of this matrix to the screen.
methods.void print(String format): Prints the value of this matrix to the screen using the same format as {@link java.io.PrintStream#printf).
methods.void reshape(int numRows, int numCols, b: Changes the number of rows and columns in the matrix, allowing its size to grow or shrink.
methods.void set(int numRows, int numCols, boole: Sets this matrix equal to the matrix encoded in the array.
methods.void set(int row, int col, double value): Assigns the element in the Matrix to the specified value.
methods.void setReshape(DenseMatrix64F b): Sets the value and shape of this matrix to be identical to the specified matrix.
methods.String toString(): Converts the array into a string format for display purposes.
methods.double unsafe_get(int row, int col): Same as Matrix64F.get(int, int) but does not perform bounds check on input parameters.
methods.void unsafe_set(int row, int col, double: Same as Matrix64F.set(int, int, double) but does not perform bounds check on input parameters.
methods.DenseMatrix64F wrap(int numRows, int num: Creates a new DenseMatrix64F around the provided data.
methods.void zero(): Sets all elements equal to zero.
